elements.name: Stays Manager Hero Card
elements.description: The primary glanceable surface of the Stays Manager. Displays current-week status with check-in/check-out dates, property thumbnail, nightly rate, and active status badge. Uses System 1 visual hierarchy so returning guests (13+ weekly visits) get instant recognition without reading. Purple left accent border signals active lease; elevated shadow draws the eye on page load.

interaction_spec.load_behavior: Card auto-focuses on page load with subtle scale animation (1.0 to 1.01 over 200ms)
interaction_spec.hover: Shadow deepens to var(--shadow-purple-lg), cursor pointer
interaction_spec.click: Navigates to full stay detail view
interaction_spec.badge_tap: No separate action, decorative status indicator
interaction_spec.weekly_evolution: After week 4, date range text shortens to 'Week 5 of 13' format

copy_spec.empty_state: No active stays — ready to find your next spot?

elements.html_css_snippet:
🏠

Sunny Loft in Capitol Hill

Mar 3 – May 26, 2026

$2,450/mo $82/night
Active

before_after.before: Flat data table listing all stays with columns for property, dates, status, and rate. Guests must scan rows to find current stay. No visual hierarchy; active and past stays look identical. Requires System 2 reading for every visit.
before_after.after: Elevated hero card with purple accent border immediately signals the active stay. Property name, dates, and monthly rate are visible in a single glance (under 2 seconds). Status badge confirms 'Active' without reading table headers. Past stays collapse below.

elements.name: Date Change Option Cards
elements.description: Three side-by-side cards presenting the Replace, Add Nights, and Remove Nights date change options. Each card shows the action type, a brief description, and the financial delta (+/- amount). Color-coded badges distinguish cost increases (amber) from savings (green). This is tap 1 of the three-tap date change flow, competing with the speed of texting the host directly.

visual_spec.layout: Three cards in a horizontal row (flex, gap 12px), each equal width. Stacks vertically on mobile (<600px).

interaction_spec.tap_1: Tapping a card selects it with purple border highlight and slight scale (1.02). Other cards dim to 60% opacity.
interaction_spec.tap_2: After selection, a date picker or calendar appears inline below the cards.
interaction_spec.tap_3: Confirm button appears with financial summary. Tap confirms the change.
interaction_spec.timing_target: Entire flow under 60 seconds from intent to confirmation.
interaction_spec.cancel: Tapping outside or pressing X dismisses without changes.

copy_spec.replace_desc: Swap your current dates for new ones
copy_spec.add_desc: Extend your stay with extra nights

elements.html_css_snippet:
🔄

Replace Dates

Swap your current dates for new ones

+$164
➕

Add Nights

Extend your stay with extra nights

+$246
➖

Remove Nights

Shorten your stay and save

before_after.before: Single 'Request Date Change' button leading to a multi-step form. Guest must choose change type from a dropdown, manually enter new dates, then wait for a host-mediated response. Financial impact is unknown until the host replies. Average completion: 3+ minutes, often abandoned for texting.
before_after.after: Three clearly labeled cards with instant financial deltas. Guest sees cost impact before committing. Tapping a card immediately opens a date picker — no dropdown, no ambiguity about Replace vs Add vs Remove. Full flow completes in under 60 seconds.

elements.name: Single-Sum Financial Display
elements.description: Displays monthly cost as the primary financial figure with nightly rate as secondary context. Uses a 3:1 typographic size ratio to anchor the guest on the number that matches their mental model (monthly budgeting) rather than the nightly rate that causes sticker shock. Appears on listing cards, listing detail pages, and stay detail views.

visual_spec.layout: Inline block, primary number left-aligned, secondary right or below depending on context

interaction_spec.hover: Nightly rate underlines subtly, tooltip shows full price breakdown on listing detail
interaction_spec.tap_nightly: On listing detail page, expands to show seasonal rate ranges
interaction_spec.static_on_cards: No interaction on listing cards — purely informational

elements.html_css_snippet:
$2,450 /mo
$82/night

before_after.before: Nightly rate displayed as primary number ('$82/night') with no monthly context. Guests must mentally multiply by ~30 to compare against apartment rents. Creates sticker shock: '$82 sounds expensive' even though $2,450/mo is competitive for furnished mid-term housing.
before_after.after: Monthly total ($2,450/mo) displayed at 28px bold as the anchor number. Nightly rate ($82/night) shown at 13px gray as supporting context. Guest instantly compares against their mental model of monthly rent without arithmetic.

elements.name: Status Badge System
elements.description: A unified color-coded badge system used across the Stays Manager, proposals, and date changes. Four states: Active (purple), Completed (gray), Pending (amber), and Error/Action Needed (red). Consistent visual language reduces cognitive load across different contexts.

visual_spec.layout: Inline pill badge, auto-width based on content

interaction_spec.context: Badge meaning is reinforced by surrounding content, no tooltip needed
interaction_spec.animation: Pending badges pulse subtly (opacity 1 to 0.7 over 2s, infinite)

elements.html_css_snippet: Active Completed Pending Action Needed

before_after.before: Inconsistent status indicators: some pages use text labels, others use colored dots, others use icons. 'Pending' on proposals looks different from 'Pending' on date changes. Guest must re-learn status meaning per context.
before_after.after: Unified pill badges with consistent color mapping across all surfaces. Purple always means active, amber always means waiting, gray always means done, red always means action needed. Zero re-learning between contexts.

elements.name: Seasonal Rate Comparison
elements.description: A two-column comparison showing the original rate versus the new rate when a date change crosses seasonal pricing boundaries. Includes a delta badge showing the per-night difference. Prevents price surprise by anchoring the guest on their existing rate before revealing the new one. Uses the 'Price Surprise Shield' emotional pattern.

visual_spec.layout: Two-column side-by-side with centered delta badge between them

interaction_spec.appears_when: Date change crosses seasonal boundary or rate changes
interaction_spec.animation: Slides in from bottom over 200ms when rate difference is calculated
interaction_spec.tooltip: Hovering 'Current' or 'New' labels shows date range for that rate period
interaction_spec.dismiss: Cannot dismiss — stays visible until date change is confirmed or cancelled

copy_spec.explanation: Rate changes due to seasonal pricing for {{season_name}}.

elements.html_css_snippet:
Current Rate

$82/night

→ +$13/night

New Rate

$95/night

before_after.before: New rate shown only after date change is submitted. Guest discovers the price difference in a confirmation email, leading to surprise and support tickets. No visual anchoring on the original rate.
before_after.after: Side-by-side comparison with original rate on left (anchor) and new rate on right. Delta badge (+$13/night) makes the difference instantly scannable. Guest sees the full financial picture before tapping confirm.

elements.name: Proposal Progress Pipeline
elements.description: A horizontal progress tracker showing proposal status through stages: Submitted, Under Review, Approved/Declined. Each stage shows who owns the action (guest or host) and estimated time. Resolves the 'waiting ache' — the anxiety of not knowing where your proposal stands. Action-assigned labels reduce perceived wait time by making the process feel transparent.

visual_spec.layout: Horizontal stepper, 3-4 nodes connected by lines, full container width

node_styles.current: var(--secondary-purple) border ring with pulsing dot center

interaction_spec.real_time: Current stage node pulses gently to indicate live status
interaction_spec.hover_node: Shows detail tooltip with timestamp and action description
interaction_spec.notification_link: Push notification deep-links to this pipeline with the updated stage highlighted
interaction_spec.collapse: On mobile, collapses to show only current stage with 'Step 2 of 3' indicator

copy_spec.stage_1_owner: Your proposal is with the host
copy_spec.action_labels: Waiting on host | Waiting on you | Complete

elements.html_css_snippet:
✓
Submitted Sent to host
Under Review Waiting on host ~24h typical
Decision Approved or declined

before_after.before: Single status label ('Pending') with no context about where in the process the proposal is, who needs to act, or how long it typically takes. Guest checks the page repeatedly, anxiety increases with each check.
before_after.after: Three-stage pipeline shows exactly where the proposal is. Pulsing dot on the current stage signals it is actively being processed. Action-owner labels ('Waiting on host') tell the guest they do not need to do anything. Time estimates set expectations.

elements.name: Schedule Compatibility Strip
elements.description: A compact day-of-week strip (S M T W T F S) on listing cards showing which days of the guest's desired schedule overlap with the listing's availability. Filled circles for matching days, hollow for mismatches. Lets guests filter by schedule compatibility at a glance without opening each listing.

visual_spec.layout: Inline row of 7 day indicators, spaced evenly, total width ~140px

color_usage.unavailable: background transparent, border 1px solid var(--border-color), text var(--text-light-gray)

interaction_spec.static_on_card: Non-interactive on listing cards, purely visual indicator
interaction_spec.hover_on_detail: On listing detail page, hovering a day shows available time slots
interaction_spec.filter_integration: Selecting days in search filter highlights matching strips across results

elements.html_css_snippet:
S M T W T F S

5 of 7 days match your schedule

before_after.before: No schedule information on listing cards. Guest must open each listing, navigate to availability calendar, and mentally compare against their own schedule. High friction causes premature abandonment of promising listings.
before_after.after: Compact S-M-T-W-T-F-S strip shows compatibility at a glance. Filled purple circles for matching days, hollow for mismatches. Guest can scan 10 listing cards in seconds and focus on the best schedule fits.

elements.name: Payment Summary Bar
elements.description: A horizontal progress bar showing total paid versus total owed for the current stay. Displays as a passive confidence signal — the guest does not need to interact, just glance. Shows the paid amount, remaining amount, and next payment date. Positioned below the hero card on the Stays Manager.

visual_spec.layout: Full-width bar with labels above and below, height 8px track with filled progress
visual_spec.background: track: var(--bg-light-gray), fill: linear-gradient to right var(--secondary-purple) to var(--accent-purple))
visual_spec.border_radius: var(--rounded-pill) 20px for the track and fill

interaction_spec.hover_bar: Tooltip shows breakdown: 'Paid: $4,900 of $7,350 | Next: $2,450 on Apr 1'
interaction_spec.animation: On page load, bar fills from 0 to current percentage over 600ms with ease-out

elements.html_css_snippet:
$4,900 paid of $7,350
Next payment: $2,450 on Apr 1

before_after.before: Payment information buried in a separate 'Billing' tab with a full transaction log table. Guest must navigate away from the stays view, load a new page, and scan rows to understand how much they have paid and what is left.
before_after.after: Compact progress bar sits right below the hero card. At a glance: 66% paid, next payment Apr 1. No page navigation, no table scanning. Financial confidence is passive — it is just there every time they visit.

elements.name: Batched Review Card
elements.description: A review prompt card that appears at natural milestone moments: Week 4, midpoint, and final stay. Instead of nagging with constant feedback requests, this batches administrative tasks into moments when the guest naturally reflects. The card acknowledges how far the guest is in their stay and frames the review as contributing to the community.

visual_spec.layout: Card, full container width, flex row with icon left and content right
visual_spec.background: var(--bg-off-white) rgb(252, 250, 255) with subtle purple tint

typography.heading: var(--font-inter), var(--text-md) 16px, var(--font-weight-semibold), var(--text-dark)
typography.cta: var(--font-inter), var(--text-sm) 12px, var(--font-weight-semibold), white on var(--secondary-purple)

interaction_spec.trigger: Appears in Stays Manager feed at week 4, midpoint, and final week
interaction_spec.dismiss: Swipe right or tap X to dismiss. Card does not reappear until next milestone.
interaction_spec.cta_tap: Opens inline review form (star rating + optional text, under 60 seconds)
interaction_spec.snooze: 'Remind me later' link pushes the prompt by 48 hours

copy_spec.week4_body: You've been at {{property}} for a month. How's it going so far?
copy_spec.midpoint_body: Your feedback helps future guests find the right fit.
copy_spec.final_body: Share your experience to help the next guest.

elements.html_css_snippet:
⭐

Halfway through your stay

Your feedback helps future guests find the right fit. It only takes a minute.

before_after.before: Review requests sent via email at random intervals, or a persistent banner on every page asking for feedback. Creates 'administrative guilt' — the guest feels nagged and avoids the platform. Low completion rates.
before_after.after: Review prompt appears only at natural milestones (week 4, midpoint, final week) when the guest is naturally reflective. Dismissible with a snooze option. Warm copy acknowledges their journey stage. Feels like a conversation, not a chore.

elements.name: Flexibility Score Signal
elements.description: A small contextual trust indicator showing how flexible a host is with date changes. Displayed as a compact inline element on listing cards and detail pages. Uses a simple 3-level system (Low / Medium / High) rather than a numeric score. Helps guests evaluate listings based on their need for schedule flexibility without overcomplicating the decision.

visual_spec.layout: Inline, single line, icon + text, height 20px
visual_spec.icon: Small flex/calendar icon (12px), color matches text

interaction_spec.hover: Tooltip explains: 'This host typically approves date change requests within 12 hours'
interaction_spec.appears: Only shown when guest has indicated schedule flexibility is important (search filter or profile)

copy_spec.tooltip_high: This host typically approves date changes within 12 hours
copy_spec.tooltip_medium: This host responds to date changes within 2 days

elements.html_css_snippet: 📅 Highly flexible host 📅 Moderately flexible 📅 Limited flexibility

before_after.before: No indication of host flexibility. Guest discovers flexibility (or lack thereof) only after submitting a date change request and waiting for a response. Leads to failed expectations and abandoned bookings.
before_after.after: Compact inline signal on listing cards and detail pages. Guest can filter for 'Highly flexible' hosts during search if schedule flexibility is a priority. Sets expectations before proposal submission.

elements.name: Date Change Bottom Sheet
elements.description: A mobile-native bottom sheet container for the three-tap date change flow. Slides up from the bottom of the screen, covering approximately 60% of the viewport. Contains the date change option cards (ui-002), a calendar picker, and a confirmation summary. Designed to feel as fast as sending a text message — the key competitor for this interaction.

visual_spec.layout: Bottom sheet, 60% viewport height, full width on mobile, max-width 480px centered on desktop
visual_spec.handle: 40px x 4px centered pill, var(--bg-light-gray), 12px from top

interaction_spec.open: Slides up from bottom over 300ms with spring easing
interaction_spec.close: Swipe down past 30% threshold or tap overlay to dismiss
interaction_spec.internal_flow: Step 1: Choose type (Replace/Add/Remove) -> Step 2: Pick dates -> Step 3: Review + Confirm
interaction_spec.confirm: Purple gradient button, full width, bottom-fixed with safe area padding

elements.html_css_snippet:
Change Your Dates

Step 1 of 3
Date change option cards go here (see ui-002)

before_after.before: Full-page form navigation. Guest leaves the Stays Manager, loads a new page, fills in a multi-field form, submits, then navigates back. Total context switches: 3. Average time: 3+ minutes. Many guests text the host instead.
before_after.after: Bottom sheet slides up in-context. Guest never leaves the Stays Manager. Three taps: choose type, pick dates, confirm. Total context switches: 0. Target time: under 60 seconds. Faster than composing a text.

elements.name: Notification Deep-Link Banner
elements.description: A contextual banner that appears at the top of the Stays Manager when the guest arrives via a push notification deep-link. Highlights the specific item that triggered the notification (e.g., 'Your date change was approved') with a direct link to the relevant section. Auto-dismisses after 8 seconds or on user interaction.

visual_spec.layout: Full-width banner, fixed at top of Stays Manager content area, height auto

interaction_spec.auto_dismiss: Fades out after 8 seconds with 300ms opacity transition
interaction_spec.tap_link: Scrolls to and highlights the relevant element (e.g., proposal pipeline, hero card)
interaction_spec.tap_dismiss: X button immediately removes the banner
interaction_spec.animation_in: Slides down from top over 200ms with ease-out

copy_spec.date_change_approved: Your date change was approved! View updated dates
copy_spec.proposal_update: Your proposal has been updated. See current status
copy_spec.payment_confirmed: Payment confirmed. View your payment summary
copy_spec.message_received: New message from your host. Open conversation

elements.html_css_snippet:
Your date change was approved!

View updated dates

before_after.before: Push notification opens the Stays Manager at the top of the page. Guest must scroll and search for what changed. No visual indicator of what is new. Often the guest cannot find the update and assumes the notification was false.
before_after.after: Notification deep-links to the Stays Manager with a highlighted banner at the top. Banner states exactly what happened and provides a direct link to scroll to the relevant section. Guest confirms the update in under 3 seconds.

elements.name: Listing Card (Schedule-First)
elements.description: A restructured search result listing card that leads with schedule compatibility and monthly price rather than nightly rate and generic amenities. Features the schedule compatibility strip (ui-007), single-sum financial display (ui-003), property thumbnail, and flexibility score (ui-010). Designed for the guest who is searching for mid-term housing that fits their work-from-home or hybrid schedule.

visual_spec.layout: Vertical card, fixed width in grid (280px) or full-width in list view
sections_top_to_bottom: Property thumbnail (16:10 aspect ratio, rounded-xl top corners)

interaction_spec.hover: Card lifts with var(--shadow-md), border transitions to var(--secondary-purple) at 30% opacity
interaction_spec.save: Heart icon in thumbnail top-right corner, tap to save/unsave
interaction_spec.lazy_load: Thumbnail lazy-loads, schedule strip renders from cached search params

elements.html_css_snippet:
S M T W T F S

Sunny Loft in Capitol Hill

Capitol Hill, Seattle

$2,450/mo $82/night
📅 Highly flexible host

before_after.before: Standard listing card leads with nightly rate, star rating, and generic amenity icons. No schedule information. Guest must open each listing to evaluate date availability and calculate monthly cost manually.
before_after.after: Schedule strip immediately shows day-of-week compatibility. Monthly price is the primary number. Flexibility score tells the guest how adaptable the host is. All critical decision factors visible without opening the listing.

elements.name: In-Platform Messaging Prompt
elements.description: A contextual prompt that surfaces the in-platform messaging feature when guests are most likely to reach for their text messaging app. Appears after proposal submission and during active lease when date changes or questions arise. Positioned as a convenience feature rather than a restriction — 'Message your host directly here, no phone number needed.' Competes directly with the temptation to text off-platform.

visual_spec.layout: Compact inline prompt, flex row, icon + text + CTA button

interaction_spec.tap_cta: Opens in-platform messaging thread with host, pre-populated with context (e.g., 'Re: Your stay at {{property}}')
interaction_spec.dismiss: X button hides for current session. Re-appears on next visit if guest has not messaged recently.
interaction_spec.appears_when: After proposal submission, on stay detail page when no recent messages, after date change is submitted

copy_spec.prompt_post_proposal: Questions about your proposal? Message {{host_name}} directly here.
copy_spec.prompt_active_lease: Need something? Message {{host_name}} — no phone number needed.
copy_spec.prompt_date_change: Want to discuss date options? Chat with {{host_name}} here.

elements.html_css_snippet:
💬

Need something? Message Sarah directly here. Avg response: 2 hours

before_after.before: Messaging feature exists but is buried in navigation. Guest defaults to texting the host directly because it is faster and more familiar. Off-platform communication means SplitLease loses visibility into disputes, date changes, and guest satisfaction signals.
before_after.after: Contextual prompt appears exactly when the guest is most likely to reach for their phone. Pre-populated thread with stay context. Average response time shown to set expectations. Messaging feels faster than composing a text because the context is already there.

elements.name: Discovery Value Proposition Hero
elements.description: An honest, expectation-setting hero section for the discovery/landing page. Instead of aspirational marketing copy that overpromises, this hero acknowledges what mid-term flexible housing actually is: 'Furnished places for a few weeks to a few months. Real pricing. Flexible dates.' Builds trust by being transparent about the product rather than overselling. Addresses the emotional need for honest expectations before the guest invests search effort.

visual_spec.layout: Full-width hero, centered text, max-width 640px for content, min-height 320px
visual_spec.cta_button: white background, var(--primary-purple) text, var(--rounded-lg) 8px, padding 14px 28px
visual_spec.spacing: 64px top/bottom padding, 24px between headline and subhead, 32px before CTA

interaction_spec.scroll_hint: Subtle down-arrow or scroll indicator at bottom of hero
interaction_spec.animation: Headline fades in over 400ms, subhead follows at 200ms delay

copy_spec.headline: Stay somewhere that fits your schedule.
copy_spec.subhead: Furnished places for a few weeks to a few months. Real pricing upfront. Flexible dates you can change.
copy_spec.trust_signal: No booking fees. Cancel up to 48 hours before check-in.

elements.html_css_snippet:
Stay somewhere that fits your schedule.

Furnished places for a few weeks to a few months. Real pricing upfront. Flexible dates you can change.

No booking fees. Cancel up to 48 hours before check-in.

before_after.before: Generic hero with aspirational stock photography and vague tagline ('Find your perfect home away from home'). Overpromises the experience, leading to disappointment during search when reality does not match expectations. No pricing transparency.
before_after.after: Honest headline acknowledges what the product actually is: schedule-flexible furnished housing. Subhead leads with 'real pricing' and 'flexible dates' — the two things guests care about most. Trust signal at bottom addresses the two biggest fears (fees and cancellation). Sets accurate expectations from the first interaction.

notes: works-007 (real-time availability) is a backend/data concern that does not produce a distinct UI element — it surfaces through existing elements like listing cards and the date change flow.
move_in phase has no dedicated UI elements per Layer 6 coherence report findings. Recommend future layer run to address move_in onboarding surface.
All HTML/CSS snippets use production CSS variables from Style-guide.md. Google Fonts (Inter, DM Sans) are imported in each snippet for standalone rendering.
Status colors (amber, green, red) are not from the production CSS variables but are standard semantic colors used consistently across all elements per looks-004 specification.
